Class MinHeap

java.lang.Object
com.utils.MinHeap
public class MinHeap extends Object
Singleton class representing a MinHeap data structure for storing MusicBand objects. This class implements the collection management functionality for the application, providing methods to add, remove, update, and query elements in the collection.

The heap is implemented using Java's PriorityQueue and maintains:

  • Command history for the last 11 commands
  • Metadata history of collection operations
  • Automatic persistence to/from file

  • Constructor Details

    • MinHeap

      public MinHeap()
      Constructs a new MinHeap instance. Initializes the heap, history, and loads data from file. Private constructor - use getInstance() to obtain the singleton.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static MinHeap getInstance()
      Gets the singleton instance of the MinHeap. Uses double-checked locking for thread safety.
      Returns:
      the singleton MinHeap instance

    • getFilePath

      public static String getFilePath()
      Gets the file path used for data persistence.
      Returns:
      the path to the data file

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile()
      Loads the collection from the default file path. Displays appropriate messages for success, warnings, or errors.

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile()
      Saves the collection to the default file path. Outputs success or error messages to standard output.

    • insert

      public void insert(MusicBand band)
      Inserts a new music band into the collection.
      Parameters:
      band - the MusicBand to insert

    • extractMin

      public MusicBand extractMin()
      Removes and returns the minimum element from the collection.
      Returns:
      the minimum MusicBand, or null if the collection is empty

    • peek

      public MusicBand peek()
      Returns the minimum element without removing it.
      Returns:
      the minimum MusicBand, or null if the collection is empty

    • printAll

      public void printAll()
      Prints all elements in the collection to standard output. Each element is printed using its toString() representation.

    • removeElById

      public boolean removeElById(Long id)
      Removes a music band from the collection by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the band to remove
      Returns:
      true if an element was removed, false otherwise

    • findById

      public MusicBand findById(Long id)
      Finds a music band in the collection by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to search for
      Returns:
      the MusicBand if found, null otherwise

    • updateElement

      public void updateElement(MusicBand updatedBand)
      Updates an existing music band in the collection with new values. Removes the old element and inserts the updated one.
      Parameters:
      updatedBand - the MusicBand with updated values (matched by ID)

    • removeElByBestAlbum

      public boolean removeElByBestAlbum(String albumName)
      Removes a music band from the collection based on its best album name. Only removes the first matching element.
      Parameters:
      albumName - the name of the best album to search for
      Returns:
      true if an element was removed, false otherwise

    • removeElementsGreaterThanId

      public int removeElementsGreaterThanId(Long id)
      Removes all music bands from the collection that have an ID greater than the specified value.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID threshold - all bands with ID greater than this will be removed
      Returns:
      the number of elements removed

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the collection.

    • printHistory

      public void printHistory()
      Prints the history of the last 11 commands executed.

    • addToHistory

      public void addToHistory(String cmd)
      Adds a command to the command history.
      Parameters:
      cmd - the command string to add to history

    • getInitializationDate

      public LocalDateTime getInitializationDate()
      Gets the date and time when the collection was initialized.
      Returns:
      the initialization date and time

    • getHeapType

      public String getHeapType()
      Gets the type description of the heap implementation.
      Returns:
      the heap type string

    • getElementCount

      public int getElementCount()
      Gets the current number of elements in the collection.
      Returns:
      the element count

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the collection is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the collection contains no elements

    • getAllElements

      public List<MusicBand> getAllElements()
      Gets all elements in the collection as a list. Returns a copy to prevent external modification of the internal heap.
      Returns:
      a list containing all music bands

    • countByNumberOfParticipants

      public int countByNumberOfParticipants(int numberOfParticipants)
      Counts the number of elements in the collection with the specified number of participants.
      Parameters:
      numberOfParticipants - the number of participants to count
      Returns:
      the count of elements matching the criteria

    • getMetadataHistory

      public List<String> getMetadataHistory()
      Gets the metadata history of collection operations.
      Returns:
      a list of metadata history entries

    • printMetadata

      public void printMetadata()
      Prints detailed metadata about the collection including type, initialization date, element count, and metadata history.
